docs.lead_paragraph: Patients who undergo surgery in a doctor's office instead of in a hospital are protected by few regulations and face dangers like outdated anesthesia equipment, according to a report by a New York Senate committee. The study, by the Senate Committee on Investigations, Taxation and Government Operations, called office surgery ''an entirely unregulated area of medicine'' in New York.

headline.main: Albany Study Finds Perils in Surgery in Doctors' Offices

docs.abstract: Report issued by New York State Senate Committee on Investigations, Taxation and Government Operations finds that patients who undergo surgery in doctor's office instead of in hospital are protected by few regulations and face dangers like outdated anesthesia equipment (M)
